column1: 1 ^ Benedícem Dòminum in òmni tèmpore~; sèmper laŭs ejus in ore meo. ^ I will bless the Lord at all times
column2: his praise shall be always in my mouth.

column1: 2 ^ In Dòmino laŭdábitur ánima mea~; áŭdiant mansuéti
column2: et laĕtèntur. ^ In the Lord shall my soul be praised~; let the meek hear
et exaltémus nomen ejus in idìpsum. ^ O magnify the Lord with me
column3: and let us extol his name together.
et ex òmnibus tribulațiónibus meîs erìpuit me. ^ I sought the Lord
column4: and he heard me~; and he delivered me from all my troubles.

column3: et fácies vèstraĕ non confundèntur. ^ Come ye to him
column5: and your faces shall not be confounded.

column3: et de òmnibus tribulațiónibus ejus salvávit eum. ^ This poor man cried
column5: and saved him out of all his troubles.

column1: 7 ^ Immìttet ángelus Dòmini in circùmitu timèntium eum
column2: et erìpiet eos. ^ The angel of the Lord shall encamp round about them that fear him

column1: 8 ^ Gustáte et vǐdéte qŭóniam suávis est Dòminus~; beátus vìr qŭi sperat in eo. ^ O taste and see that the Lord is sweet~; blessed is the man that hopeth in him.

column2: òmnes sancti ejus~; qŭóniam non est inòpia timèntibus eum. ^ Fear the Lord
column3: all ye his saints~; for there is no want to them that fear him.

column2: et esurivérunt~; inqŭirèntes aŭtem Dòminum non minuèntur òmni bono. ^ The rich have wanted
column3: and have suffered hunger~; but they that seek the Lord shall not be deprived of any good.
aŭdíte me~; timórem Dòmini docébo vos. ^ Come
column5: hearken to me~; I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

column2: díligit dies vǐdére bonos~? ^ Who is the man that desireth life
column3: who loveth to see good days~?

column2: et lábia tua ne loqŭántur dolum. ^ Keep thy tongue from evil
column3: and thy lips from speaking guile.
et persèqŭere eam. ^ Turn away from evil
column4: and do good~; seek after peace

column2: et aŭres ejus in prèces eórum. ^ The eyes of the Lord are upon the just
column3: and his ears unto their prayers.

column1: 16 ^ Vùltus aŭtem Dòmini super facièntes mala
column2: ut pèrdat de terra memóriam eórum. ^ But the countenance of the Lord is against them that do evil things
column3: to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
et ex òmnibus tribulațiónibus eórum liberávit eos. ^ The just cried
column5: and delivered them out of all their troubles.

column1: 18 ^ Juxta est Dòminus eîs qŭi tribuláto sunt corde
column2: et húmiles spíritu salvábit. ^ The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart
column3: and he will save the humble of spirit.

column2: et de òmnibus hîs liberábit eos Dòminus. ^ Many are the afflictions of the just
column3: and from them all will the Lord deliver them.

column1: 20 ^ Custódit Dòminus òmnia òssua eórum~; unum ex hîs non conterétur. ^ The Lord keepeth all their bones~; not one of them shall be broken.
21 ^ Mors peccatórum pèssima~; et qŭi odérunt justum delìnqŭent. ^ The death of the wicked is very evil~; and they that hate the just shall be guilty.

column2: et non delìnqŭent òmnes qŭi sperant in eo. ^ The Lord will redeem the souls of his servants
column3: and none of them that trust in him shall offend.
